item.title: Why Apache Kafka doesn't need fsync to be safe — Jack Vanlightly
item.description: TLDR: Apache Kafka doesn’t need fsyncs to be safe because it includes recovery in its replication protocol. It is a real-world distributed system that uses asynchronous log writing + recovery with some additional extra safety built-in. Asynchronous log writing allows it to provide robust performance
